title: 820-00165-A Orange Light, No Power
message:
Hey! 

I'm new here but I have been [I][B]trying [/B][/I]to troubleshoot boards for a while. I have this board in that has an orange light but does not turn on, no fan spin. PPBUS_G3H is showing 8.56v on both sides of f7140. I found a cap that was askew [c7094] and replaced it. Before doing so, PP3V42_G3H was showing around 1.8V on pin 2 of L7095, now PP3V42_G3H is showing 3.335v on the same pin. 

Not sure where to go from here, i could really use some help. Thank you!

As a side note, are there any resources someone can point me to to break down the sleep states for macbooks? Just trying to wrap my head around the logical progression from initial power to boot.

title: 820-00165-A Orange Light, No Power
message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

Do you get 3v3_S5?
Check PM_BATLOW_L, PCH_DSWVRMEN, PM_DSW_PWRGD, SMC_ADAPTER_EN and PCH's RTC signals.

[URL unfurl="true"]https://logi.wiki/index.php/G3_to_S3_State_for_Ivy_Bridge_Haswell_and_Broadwell[/URL]

Be sure to use original Magsafe 2 charger.

title: 820-00165-A Orange Light, No Power
message: Thank you! Ill post them when i get back in my shop on tuesday. In the mean time, im off to study :)

title: 820-00165-A Orange Light, No Power
message:
3v3_s5: 3.335v
PM_BATLOW_L: 3.309v
PCH_DSWVRMEN: 3.03v but drops to 2.8 temporarily
PM_DSW_PWRGD: 3.352v
SMC_ADAPTER_EN: 3.356v

PCH RTC: I may need some guidance on this, what signals do i need to check for? Im not sure if my meter is sufficient enough to measure clock signals, and since I have not measured clock signals before, I'm not sure if I'm doing it correctly (each probe on the terminals of the oscillator). In this case, am i checking PCH_CLK32K_RTCX1 against ground on my Hz setting on my meter?

I've got a Klein Tools MM400.

 Thanks!

title: 820-00165-A Orange Light, No Power
message:
I meant DC voltage of RTC signals.
RTC clock isn't needed there (yet).
[URL unfurl="true"]https://boards.rossmanngroup.com/threads/how-to-collection.60974/[/URL]
Check if 3V3_SUS comes on too.

title: 820-00165-A Orange Light, No Power
message:
RTC_RESET_L:3.24v
PCH_SRTCRST_L:3.27v
PCH_INTRUDER_L:2.06v
PCH_INTVRMEN:2.77v
3v3_SUS:3.33v

title: 820-00165-A Orange Light, No Power
message: Trigger SMC_ONOFF_L and check for drop pulse at PM_PWRBTN_L (at same time).

title: 820-00165-A Orange Light, No Power
message: yes it does

title: 820-00165-A Orange Light, No Power
message:
PM_SLP_S4_L should pulse at same time; check that.
If catch it, check at ALL_SYS_PWRGD too.

Worth to try SMC bypass too...

title: 820-00165-A Orange Light, No Power
message: Will check / give that a try when I'm back in office. really appreciate your help

title: 820-00165-A Orange Light, No Power
message:
PM_SLP_S4_L is at 0.0mv without power button 
does that indicate short on that line?

Not sure if this is relevant, but r1461 shows 0.483v on pin 2 diode mode

not surprisingly, SMC bypass did not work, no ALL_SYS_PWRGD either

title: 820-00165-A Orange Light, No Power
message: I asked if you catch any pulse at PM_SLP_S4_L [B][U]when[/U][/B] pressing power button (at same time).

title: 820-00165-A Orange Light, No Power
message: oh my bad, i thought it was brought to logic low like the other. No it does not change with power button

title: 820-00165-A Orange Light, No Power
message:
Then seems to have a PCH related issue.

"PCH_INTRUDER_L:2.06v"
Force this signal soldering 100K instead of 1M (R1301).

title: 820-00165-A Orange Light, No Power
message:
PCH_INTRUDER_L: 3.1v
pulse on PM_PWRBTN_L and none on PM_SLP_S4_L still

title: 820-00165-A Orange Light, No Power
message:
Be sure 1V05_SUS is present.

You can try heating PCH area untill 200 degress Celsius, for 20-30s aprox.
No need to melt the balls; the idea is to burn eventually accumulated crap.
Use quality flux!

title: 820-00165-A Orange Light, No Power
message:
1V05_SUS: 1.06v

Should I leave the underfill?

title: 820-00165-A Orange Light, No Power
message: Is better to clean it, at least on the PCH's corners.

title: 820-00165-A Orange Light, No Power
message: No luck, anything else I should try?

title: 820-00165-A Orange Light, No Power
message: PM_RSMRST_L stays always high?

title: 820-00165-A Orange Light, No Power
message: constant 3.1v drops to 2.7v with power button

title: 820-00165-A Orange Light, No Power
message:
Should be stable always.
Check what happens removing U8130.

title: 820-00165-A Orange Light, No Power
message: PM_RSMRST_L: 3.27v drops to 2.91v with power button

title: 820-00165-A Orange Light, No Power
message:
putting it back on, again reads 3.27v drops to 2.8v with power

oem original charger

title: 820-00165-A Orange Light, No Power
message:
Board doesn't try to turn on without U8130?
No pulse at all at PM_SLP_S4_L?
In such case, bad PCH...

title: 820-00165-A Orange Light, No Power
message: Nothing.. Thanks for the help!

title: 820-00165-A Orange Light, No Power
message: If you wouldn't mind, would you care to briefly explain why you had me test all of those lines? I have been following along with the tree that you sent at the beginning, but hearing it directly may help me understand even better.

title: 820-00165-A Orange Light, No Power
message:
PCH requires some basic signals and voltages, in order to start power on sequence.
In fact, it doesn't reply to power button at all.
All previous checks assured that PCH receives all these.
